description: LeBron James, one of the most popular athletes in the world, officially endorsed Democratic Vice President Kamala Harris on Thursday, rebuking Donald Trump in a video that highlighted the Republican candidate’s oft-inflammatory rhetoric on race.
title: LeBron James Backs Harris by Invoking Trump’s Rhetoric on Race

description: Early results from Botswana’s election point to the party that has ruled the diamond-rich nation for the past 58 years losing its grip on power.
title: Early Botswana Vote Tallies Point to Shock Loss For Ruling Party

description: Chicago Board of Education President Mitchell Johnson stepped down on Thursday, one week after taking the oath of office, following revelations about controversial social media posts he’d made.
title: Chicago School Board President Resigns a Week After Taking Oath

description: America’s soft power influence over China’s 1.4 billion people is being quickly eroded by the vitriol and suspicion seeded by Donald Trump eight years ago.
title: The US Is Squandering Its Hidden Advantage Over Xi Jinping

description: This is Washington Edition, the newsletter about money, power and politics in the nation’s capital. Today, White House correspondent Josh Wingrove looks at how former President Donald Trump is planting seeds of doubt about the legitimacy of the vote should he lose the election.
title: Trump Primes the Pump to Portray an Election Loss as Fraud

description: Spain is deploying 1,700 soldiers to assist in relief efforts to rescue victims trapped by the disastrous storms that have killed more than 150 people in eastern Spain, as rain continues to spread in other parts of the country.
title: Spain Deploys 1,700 Soldiers to Assist Deadly Storm Relief

description: Police have released a description of the suspect in two ballot box fires in Oregon and Washington as election officials are rushing to send replacement ballots to the voters who were affected.
title: Ballot Box Arsonist Sought in Oregon and Washington Attacks

description: Nigeria’s state governors have asked for the withdrawal of legislation to amend the nation’s tax laws, dealing a blow to President Bola Tinubu’s bid to increase revenue to plug a widening spending gap.
title: Nigerian States Reject Tinubu’s Tax Reforms in a Blow to Revenue Drive

description: Republican lawmakers stepped up their campaign to pressure colleges including Harvard, Northwestern and Columbia to take a stronger stance against antisemitism with a report that scrutinizes their responses to protests that erupted after the Hamas attack on Israel last year.
title: Harvard, Northwestern Hit by Republicans Over Antisemitism

description: Viktor Orban held a phone call with Donald Trump on Thursday, raising concerns among some European Union officials that the Hungarian premier may be planning to invite him to dial into an upcoming EU meeting should he win next week’s US election.
title: Orban Stirs Up Concerns He Plans a Trump Surprise for EU Leaders

description: California will ask voters next week whether it should borrow another $20 billion for schools and climate change programs, the most state bonds they’ve been asked to approve during a single election in almost two decades.
title: California to Test Voters’ Mettle, Seeking $20 Billion in Bonds

description: Vice President Kamala Harris seized on a remark from Donald Trump that he would “protect” women if elected, whether they “like it or not” to assail her Republican rival’s stance on reproductive rights and other freedoms in an appeal to suburban and independent women.
title: Harris Seizes On Trump’s Vow to Protect Women Whether They ‘Like It Or Not’

description: Moldova’s plan to join the European Union will be written into the country’s constitution after the highest court approved results of a recent referendum, rejecting claims by the pro-Russian opposition that the vote was flawed.
title: Moldova’s Top Court Clears Pro-EU Referendum in Blow to Russia

description: Stephanie Flanders and former OBR chief of staff Andy King join Merryn Talks Money to discuss what it means for UK citizens, businesses and the government.
title: What Did Rachel Reeves Risk With Her First Budget?

description: Elon Musk and other Donald Trump allies are working to exploit a crack in rival Kamala Harris’ Blue Wall: the thousands of Pennsylvania voters who have drifted over the past decade away from her Democratic Party.
title: Musk Looks for Trump Votes Among Former Pennsylvania Democrats

description: Chancellor of the Exchequer Rachel Reeves defended her move to levy inheritance tax on UK landowners who pass down agricultural property to their children, after critics said the move would hurt the sector and lead to the breakup of family farms.
title: Reeves Defends Inheritance Tax Rise After Backlash From Farmers

description: Live results in the 2024 presidential race, with interactive maps and electoral vote counts — plus coverage of races for governor, US Senate and US House.
title: 2024 US Election Results: Live Maps and Market Reactions

description: On a bright Sunday afternoon, two men walked door to door through a Forsyth County, Georgia, neighborhood on a mission to get out the vote for Democrats.
title: Indian Americans in Swing States Become Prime Democratic Targets

description: In a live Q&A on the Markets Today blog, we asked experts from around the newsroom for their analysis of UK Chancellor Rachel Reeves’s first budget.
title: What Does the UK Budget Mean for Markets: Q&A Transcript

description: A Kenyan court rejected a bid to block the appointment of President William Ruto’s new deputy.
title: Kenya Court Rules Deputy President’s Swearing-In Can Proceed

description: Mozambicans are bracing for more political turmoil following an opposition leader’s call for a week of protests against what he said was a rigged election.
title: Mozambique Braces for Renewed Protests After Disputed Election

description: The Bank for International Settlements is leaving a project for digital cross-border payments after Russia’s president Vladimir Putin identified the underlying technology as a tool to circumvent sanctions and potentially undermine the dollar.
title: BIS Steps Back From Cross-Border Payment Project Touted by Putin

description: Harris and Trump have both touted the promise of lower energy bills while campaigning for president — but they’ve laid out starkly different visions for how to get them.
title: As America Votes, These Big Energy Projects Hang in the Balance

description: Colombians are far angrier about crooked officials than they are about all the other problems facing their nation, according to a new poll.
title: Corruption Dwarfs Every Other Issue for Colombians in New Poll

description: Mexicans are divided about the need of tighter migration policies, amid a large influx of foreigners crossing their country toward the US border, according to a new poll.
title: Mexicans Split on Whether Stricter Migration Policy Is Needed

description: President Javier Milei’s approval rating has taken a hit nearly a year into office, but Argentines still prefer him over all of his political rivals.
title: Milei Is Argentina’s Most Popular Leader But Disapproval Grows

description: Chileans are demanding stricter immigration controls much more than neighbors in other Latin American nations, according to a new poll, as an influx of newcomers upends politics in one of the region’s richest economies.
title: Nearly Everybody in Chile Wants More Restrictions on Immigration

description: Welcome to Balance of Power, bringing you the latest in global politics. If you haven’t yet, sign up here.
title: Biden Gaffe Hands Trump a Late Political Gift

description: The leader of the small Japanese political party that could become a useful ally for a weakened government dug in his heels over a demand for income tax breaks in return for support for the ruling Liberal Democratic Party.
title: Japan’s Tamaki Digs In Over Tax Demand to Support Ailing LDP

description: Hundreds of millions of Indians breathe some of the world’s most toxic air year round. Air pollution in the capital area that’s home to about 30 million people is especially stubborn. In winter, the cold weather actually makes the smog even worse — and potent. One measure of pollution in New Delhi frequently exceeds the World Health Organization’s daily recommended limits by a factor of more than 20. Studies show India’s dirty air has been killing about a million or more people a year, a massive
title: Why India’s Delhi Has One of World’s Worst Air Pollution Problems

description: Donald Trump and his allies are telling supporters that they’re on pace for a runaway victory barring fraud — setting the stage for outrage and legal challenges if the election doesn’t break in favor of Republicans.
title: Trump Insists He Has Big Lead Over Harris, Setting Stage for 2024 Doubts

description: China’s probe into AstraZeneca Plc has reached its uppermost echelons, ensnaring local president Leon Wang and throwing into question the future of the most successful Western pharmaceutical company in the country.
title: AstraZeneca’s Drive for China Dominance in Focus as Chief Probed

description: Spain’s governing Socialist party reached an agreement with partners in parliament to extend a windfall tax on banks for three more years.
title: Spain Shelves Energy Windfall Tax, Plans to Extend Bank Levy to 2027

description: The Hanoi People’s Court sentenced blogger Duong Van Thai to 12 years in prison after convicting him of disseminating anti-party and anti-state content, VietnamPlus news website reported, citing information from the court.
title: Vietnam Gives Blogger Jail Term for Anti-State Content: Media

description: A group of former Thai central bank chiefs is calling for the appointment of a non-political person to chair the bank amid reports that the government is pushing the candidature of a former finance minister to tighten its grip over the monetary authority.
title: Former Thai Central Bankers Pitch for Apolitical Board Chair

description: South Korea’s economy would likely suffer a contraction if Donald Trump returns to the White House and ratchets up tariffs against trading partners, according to a government-affiliated think tank.
title: South Korean Economy Would Shrink Under Trump Duties, Study Says

description: The leader of one of Taiwan’s last diplomatic allies in the Pacific said his nation is under increasing pressure from China to end its support for Taipei.
title: Pacific Island Leader Says China Is Pressing for Taiwan Switch

description: Australia’s Prime Minister Anthony Albanese has denied personally calling former Qantas Airways Ltd. boss Alan Joyce to ask for flight upgrades, as a growing scandal over free perks provided by the national carrier threatens to engulf his government.
title: Australia PM Denies Asking Ex-Qantas CEO Directly for Upgrades

description: Mexico’s Lower House voted to shield changes to the constitution from being impacted by Supreme Court decisions, days before a meeting of the top court to review a controversial overhaul of the country’s judiciary.
title: Mexico Lawmakers Shield Judicial Overhaul From Court Decisions
